settings.text: High blood pressure is treated with the prescription drug sectral. It is a member of the beta blocker drug subclass.Beta blockers function by preventing the action of specific hormones that constrict blood vessels, allowing the heart to pump blood more easily. Users of Welzo can use this article's information to learn more about Sectral.
Sectral is a blood pressure medication.In those with high blood pressure or heart conditions, it may also be used to prevent heart attacks and strokes.

Sectral's most frequent negative effects include:

tiredness

dizziness

lightheadedness

nausea

Among the less frequent side effects are:

constipation

diarrhea

mouth ache

rare adverse effects consist of:

depression

impotence

Contact your doctor if you experience any of these side effects.

Sectral is typically started at a dose of 100 mg once daily. Depending on how you react to the medication, your doctor may change the dosage.

Following your doctor's instructions precisely, take Sectral. Never take it in amounts larger or smaller than advised or for a longer period of time.

Sectral should be taken in the recommended dosage of 160 mg once daily to prevent heart attacks and strokes.

Usually, sectral is taken either with or without food. If you take Sectral with food, make an effort to take it at the same time every day to keep the drug's levels in your blood consistent.

Sectral may interact with other drugs, supplements, or herbal remedies you may be taking. When a substance modifies how a drug functions, there is an interaction. This could be harmful or stop the medication from working properly.

Your doctor needs to carefully monitor all of your medications to help you avoid interactions. Tell your doctor about all medications, supplements, and herbal products you use. Each time you receive a new medication, keep a list of them to show your doctor and pharmacist.

Drug interactions with Sectral include:

ACE inhibitors like enalapril (Vasotec), quinapril (Accupril), lisinopril (Zestril), benazepril (Lotensin), and ramipril (Altace)

Candesartan (Atacand), eprosartan (Tevetan), irbesartan (Avapro), losartan (Cozaar), olmesartan (Benicar), telmisartan (Micardis), and valsartan (Diovan) are angiotensin receptor blockers.

Calcium channel blockers include verapamil (Calan, Covera HS, Isoptin SR, Verelan), amlodipine (Norvasc), diltiazem (Cardizem, Dilacor XR, Tiazac, among others), felodipine (Plendil), isradipine (DynaCirc CR), nicardipine (Cardene SR), nifedipine

Lanoxin's digoxin

Bumetanide (Bumex), chlorothiazide (Diuril), furosemide (Lasix), hydrochlorothiazide (HydroDIURIL, Microzide), indapamide (LOZOL), metolazone (Zaroxolyn), spironolactone (Aldactone), and torsemide (Demadex), among others, are diuretics (also known as "water

(Lithobid) lithium

supplements with potassium

Prednisone (Rayos) and other steroids

This list of Sectral drug interactions is not exhaustive. For more information, consult your physician or pharmacist.
Sectral works by inhibiting the activity of specific hormones that constrict blood vessels, facilitating the heart's ability to pump blood more easily.

Sectral absorbs quickly from the digestive system and reaches its peak concentrations in about an hour.Sectral has a bioavailability of about 50%.The kidneys and liver both metabolize and eliminate secosteral.Half-LifeSectral has a half-life of about 3 hours.

Other blood pressure medications like ACE inhibitors, angiotensin receptor blockers, calcium channel blockers, and diuretics are alternatives to Sectral.

Hawthorn (Crataegus laevigata), magnesium, and other herbs and supplements can be used as natural alternatives to Sectral.

Consult your doctor or pharmacist first before beginning any new medication regimen.
